subNodes.conversationText: root
I heard about your actions in the Dwarven Halls.  You have accomplished something we didn't think was possible.|***gc_journal_entry-->NOT::False    String::hideout    String::10    |
We are searching for my father and we were told you might know of his where abouts.
Yes, Numblin told me that Adwen is your father.  He and I have become good friends over the past number of years.  I am sure Numblin told you that he was taken away to Zorn's prison.
Yes and Numblin told us that you would know how we could find the location.
I know where it is, but I doubt you will be able to simply storm the fortress and save your father.
We need to meet with Jerun in Charnia and put together a plan that will be successful.
Great, when do we leave?
I will mark on your map the safe path to Charnia.  Talk with Kelv, in the storage room here, if you need any supplies or new equipment.
I need to finish a few preparations in this region, but I will try and meet with you and Jerun in Charnia.
May I ask you a few questions while we are here?
We have time, ask away.
Where are all of the other Charnians in hiding?
Most, from this hideout, are out on patrols or other tasks.  The Zornians do not know that we Charnians in hidding even exist.
May we ask you another question?
What have you heard about Zorn's return?
Those rumors began not to long ago, about the time that your father and a few others were taken away to the prisons.
From what we have learned, it sounds like there is a new power working along side Zorn.  A witch of sorts, although reported to be beautiful and cruel.
It does appear that Zorn has returned although it should not be possible unless Elos' power has diminished.
May we ask you another question?
Why have you not sent anyone across the Grimstan Mountains to search for help?
We have in years past, but none have ever returned.
We came to believe that none of the Charnians survived who tried to escape through the Grimstan Mountains.
It wasn't until your father arrived that we learned of your existence.
We have tried to send for help since then, but again none have returned and no help has come until you arrived.
May we ask you another question?
We don't have anymore questions and we should probably get going.
Take care and stay close to the river on your journey to Charnia.  I'll meet up with you soon.
We'll see you later.
Thanks again, friends...|***ga_force_exit-->String::Suril    String::wp_suril_exit    Int::1    ***ga_give_xp-->Int::700    Int::1    |
Welcome to the hideout of the Charnians.  I have heard about your actions in the Dwarven Halls.  You have accomplished something we didn't think was possible.
We are searching for my father, Adwen.  Maybe you might know of his where abouts?
Adwen is your father?  He and I have become good friends over the past number of years.  Unfortunately I must inform you that he was taken away to Zorn's prison.
Do you know how we can find the location.
I know where it is, but I doubt you will be able to simply storm the fortress and save your father.
We need to meet with Jerun in Charnia and put together a plan that will be successful.
Great, when do we leave?
I will mark on your map the safe path to Charnia.  Talk with Kelv, in the storage room here, if you need any supplies or new equipment.
I need to finish a few preparations in this region, but I will try and meet with you and Jerun in Charnia.
May I ask you a few questions while we are here?
We have time, ask away.
Where are all of the other Charnians in hiding?
Most, from this hideout, are out on patrols or other tasks.  The Zornians do not know that we Charnians in hiding even exist.
May we ask you another question?
What have you heard about Zorn's return?
Those rumors began not to long ago, about the time that your father and a few others were taken away to the prisons.
From what we have learned, it sounds like there is a new power working along side Zorn.  A witch of sorts, although reported to be beautiful and cruel.
It does appear that Zorn has returned although it should not be possible unless Elos' power has diminished.
May we ask you another question?
Why have you not sent anyone across the Grimstan Mountains to search for help?
We have in years past, but none have ever returned.
We came to believe that none of the Charnians survived who tried to escape through the Grimstan Mountains.
It wasn't until your father arrived that we learned of your existence.
We have tried to send for help since then, but again none have returned and no help has come until you arrived.
May we ask you another question?
We don't have anymore questions and we should probably get going.
Take care and stay close to the river on your journey to Charnia.  I'll meet up with you soon.
We'll see you later.
Thanks again, friends...|***ga_force_exit-->String::Suril    String::wp_suril_exit    Int::1    ***ga_give_xp-->Int::700    Int::1    |
